question: Which of these summary statistics always has a unique value for a given dataset?

answers.feedback: Incorrect. When the number of points in a dataset is even, there is not a single data value in the middle of the dataset. In this case, the value of the median can be defined in different ways.
Incorrect. There may be multiple values that all occur the same number of times, and there is no unique mode in such a case.

question: Which of these statistics is less sensitive to outliers?

answers.feedback: Incorrect. The sample mean can change significantly in the presence of outliers.
Correct. Because the median returns a value in the middle of the dataset, it is not significantly affected by the particular values of outliers.

question: Find the median of the data set $[4, 5, 3, 4, 4]$.

answers.feedback: Correct. The sorted data is $[3,4,4,4,5]$, so the middle value is 4.
Incorrect. Although 3 is the middle value of the data as displayed in the question, the median is the middle value of the sorted data.
Incorrect. The median will always be a value in the data set, or the average of the middle two values if there are an even number of data points.
Incorrect. The median will always be a value in the data set, or the average of the middle two values if there are an even number of data points.
Incorrect.

question: Find the mode of the data set $[4, 5, 3, 4, 4]$.

answers.feedback: Correct. The value 4 appears 3 times, whereas the other data values only appear 1 time each.
Incorrect. The mode will always be a value in the data set, or the average of the middle two values if there are an even number of data points.
Incorrect. The mode will always be a value in the data set, or the average of the middle two values if there are an even number of data points.
Incorrect.

question: Find the average (sample mean) of the data set $[4, 5, 3, 4, 4]$.

answers.feedback: Correct.
Incorrect. Although the mean is not always a value in the data set, it will always be a value that lies between the minimum and maximum data values.
Incorrect. Although the mean is not always a value in the data set, it will always be a value that lies between the minimum and maximum data values.
Incorrect.
